building, environment.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Janin Atlas is starting a major project in the city of Toronto, ON, Canada and is looking for the best candidates to join the Project team and support the Project delivery.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Project overview :<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>The Ontario Line is a 15.6 km stand-alone rapid transit line that will connect the Ontario Science Centre to Exhibition \u002F Ontario Place.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>The Ontario Line South (OLS) project, is a design-build and finance contract for the 6 km southern portion of the Ontario Line, from Exhibition \u002F Ontario Place to the Don Yard portal (west of Don River)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>The scope of the Project includes the design, construction, and handover of all tunnels (twin tube of 6 km each), 7 stations (turnkey for: 1 station at grade and 6 underground stations) and civil works<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b> WE ARE HIRING AN EXPERIENCED ESTIMATOR F\u002FM<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What you will do :<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Estimate the costs of the portions of the works, in details and in a timely manner; the costs estimates shall be detailed and organized to get a rapid understanding and validation from the Project Team management and the Project Sponsor team. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Concretely, your tasks will be :<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Analyze the risks, uncertainties, opportunities of the works<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Obtain, review, analyse and compare the offers and quotes from subcontractors and\u002For suppliers<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Establish and analyse the costs ratios of the project<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Make a costs estimate synthesis for each new costs estimate<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Make a costs estimate follow-up table<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure a proper coordination with the project team to establish the most accurate possible costs estimate of the works<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Follow specific KPIs to track the progress and efficiency of the estimating tasks, being part of the changes management processes<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Attend coordination meetings with construction and technical teams; make site visits to integrate adequate site practicality<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Who we are looking for : <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>5 years of professional experience in estimating in the construction industry<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in heavy-civil work<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in design and build projects (and PPP projects)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proactivity to get and to access <p><b>Lead Surveyor<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Location: Toronto, ON<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>JANIN ATLAS<\u002Fb>,<b> <\u002Fb>a subsidiary of <b>VINCI Construction <\u002Fb>Grands Projets, specializes in the design and construction of major civil engineering and building works in Canada.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Janin Atlas is characterized by experienced teams sharing values of health and safety, quality, and operational excellence. It is involved in the realization of complex projects related to various fields of activities: transport, hydraulic and mining infrastructures, energy, and oil &amp; gas, building, environment.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are starting a major project in the city of Toronto, ON, Canada. We are looking for the best candidates to join our team and support the project delivery.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Project overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> — The Ontario Line is a 15.6 km stand-alone rapid transit line that will connect the Ontario Science Centre to Exhibition \u002F Ontario Place.<br> — The OLS project, is one of the three P3 contracts to deliver the Ontario Line, it is a design-build and finance contract for the 6 km southern portion of the Ontario Line, from Exhibition \u002F Ontario Place to the Don Yard portal (west of Don River)<br> — The scope of the Project includes the design, construction, and handover of all tunnels (twin tube of 6 km each), 7 stations (turnkey for 1 station at grade and 6 underground stations) and civil works<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Position's Main Objectives<\u002Fb>: Take charge of site survey activities at a particular section of the project.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Reporting to: <\u002Fb>Survey Manager<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Principal Accountability &amp; Responsibility<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp> \n <p> Understand and execute all necessary survey works to achieve the requirements.<br> Report directly to the Survey Manager whenever he\u002Fshe finds a mistake\u002Fissue or if he\u002Fshe has any doubt on site about the coordinates, alignment, elevation, safety etc. <br> Have good operational knowledge of GPS, total station and level instruments.<br> Responsible for the setting-out and measurement on site.<br> Show and explain the points staked out on site to the concerning colleague (Site Engineer, Site Foreman, etc.).<br> Read and understand design and methods drawings. <br> Use and establish benchmark references, according to proper survey methods.<br> Follow up the proper maintenance of survey equipment and accessories. <br> Control as required the quality of work of her\u002Fhis team. <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Key Skills and Knowledge<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp> \n <p> Leadership and responsibility.<br> Good communication with the construction team and other project members.<br> Good knowledge of construction methods such as earthworks and concrete formwork.<br> Good safety culture and ability to give the good example when it comes to being safe on site.<br> Fluency in English.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Education: <\u002Fb>Engineering Degree or Civil Engineering Degree with experience in relevant stream, or any survey related degree.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Experience<\u002Fb>: minimum 5 years of professional experience <p><b>Procurement Officer<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Location: Toronto, ON<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>JANIN ATLAS<\u002Fb>,<b> <\u002Fb>a subsidiary of <b>VINCI Construction <\u002Fb>Grands Projets, specializes in the design and construction of major civil engineering and building works in Canada.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Janin Atlas is characterized by experienced teams sharing values of health and safety, quality, and operational excellence. It is involved in the realization of complex projects related to various fields of activities: transport, hydraulic and mining infrastructures, energy, and oil &amp; gas, building, environment.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are starting a major project in the city of Toronto, ON, Canada. We are looking for the best candidates to join our team and support the project delivery.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Project overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> — The Ontario Line is a 15.6 km stand-alone rapid transit line that will connect the Ontario Science Centre to Exhibition \u002F Ontario Place.<br> — The OLS project, is one of the three P3 contracts to deliver the Ontario Line, it is a design-build and finance contract for the 6 km southern portion of the Ontario Line, from Exhibition \u002F Ontario Place to the Don Yard portal (west of Don River)<br> — The scope of the Project includes the design, construction, and handover of all tunnels (twin tube of 6 km each), 7 stations (turnkey for 1 station at grade and 6 underground stations) and civil works<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Position's Main Objectives<\u002Fb>: To support the purchase team in addressing and providing solutions for the project's procurement.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Reporting to: <\u002Fb>Procurement Manager<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Principal Accountability &amp; Responsibility<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> 1. Execution:<br> Develop, implement, manage and co-ordinate the procurement processes and be able to use legally established professional and transparent procurement policies and procedures of the project.<br> Draw up a plan for the purchase of equipment, services and supplies.<br> Oversee the activities of the department responsible for purchases and stocks.<br> Approve the best products and\u002For services taking into consideration costs after having reviewed and analysed all options.<br> Ensure that the products and\u002For services have the required quality and stardards, in light of the allocated budget\u002Fprice.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> 2. Supervision:<br> As part of its supervising role, the Procurement Officer is responsible for assigning duties to each staff member and review their work regularly.<br> Effectively supervise assigned staff ensuring they are adequately versed in the relevant practices, procedures and policies.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> 3. Coordination:<br> Prepare calls for tender and follow-up procedures and manage any type of contract (services, works, and supplies)<br> Provide assistance related with procurement matters to the organisation's members.<br> Act as a main link between the project and its suppliers.<br> Search for suppliers and negotiate the best deals for the project.<br> Develop good relationships with suppliers and have demonstrated excellent negotiations skills.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> 4. Documentation:<br> Maintain accurate records of purchases and pricing.<br> Ensure that the department has all important details (such as: suppliers qualifications, delivery times, potential development, products, etc.).<br> Additional preparation of Ad-hoc reports and tasks upon request.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><b> <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Key Skills and Knowledge<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp> \n <p> Excellent negotiation skills with high level of knowledge regarding the Canadian market.<br> Trust-worthy, goal oriented, creative, innovative and high ability to work under pressure<br> Fluent in English. French an asset.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Education: <\u002Fb>University Degree in Law, Public or Business Administration or equivalent academic or professional training.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p>Talent Acquisition Specialist for the Ontario Line South project<\u002Fp>\n <p> Queen Street East, Toronto, ON, Canada<\u002Fp>\n <p> Are you looking for your next adventure? Let us tell you all about it! The HR team at Ontario Transit Group are so proud to be part of Ontario’s future.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Ontario Line South<\u002Fp>\n <p> Our team is mobilizing its design and construction crews, with major works to commence in 2023. The South Civil contract is anticipated to be completed in 2030.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The project will strengthen Ontario’s economy by supporting an estimated 1,500 jobs at the peak of construction.<\u002Fp>\n <p> What is the project?<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> A six-kilometre tunnel and associated tunnelling works from Exhibition to Don Yard portal (west of the Don River)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Stations:<\u002Fli>\n  <li> One above-ground station to be integrated with the existing GO Transit Exhibition Station<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Two underground stations to be integrated with the existing TTC Osgoode and Queen subway stations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Four new underground stations (King\u002FBathurst, Queen\u002FSpadina, Moss Park, Corktown)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> The benefits to Ontario!<\u002Fp>\n <p> Faster, more frequent, and reliable access to rapid transit with more than 227,500 people will live within a 10-minute walk of an Ontario Line station<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Improve the quality of life for commuters by reducing daily travel time<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Reduce crowding on the existing Line 1 (Yonge-University) subway<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Up to 57,000 more jobs accessible by transit (in 45 minutes or less) for Toronto residents<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Economic and community growth along the future transit line and thousands of job opportunities annually during construction<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Reduction in traffic congestion, greenhouse gases and fuel consumption by providing an alternative transportation option<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Are you the perfect fit?<\u002Fp>\n <p> High energy, resilient, passionate, and experienced in all things Talent, why? because we are!<br> Happy to work at our office in downtown Toronto?<br> If so, look at this great opportunity for a Talent Acquisition Specialist.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> What you will undertake<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Lead the full-cycle recruitment process for salaried positions, including interviewing, offer negotiations, and onboarding.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Sourcing candidates through various channels<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Pipelining of strong Talent for current and future hiring needs of the business<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Planning\u002Fscheduling interview and selection procedures<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Working with internal managers supporting them with all recruitment activities (including job postings, applicant screening, and feedback briefings)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Hosting or participating in career events<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Working with the HR team on shared projects<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> The outputs<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> An informed and positive talent experience for all applicants<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Reporting on key areas of the recruitment successes and opportunities with resolution strategies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Keeping up to date with industry trends and bringing new innovative ideas to the table<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Applicant Tracking System expert ensuring full capabilities are being utilized and always being aware of the future of technology and sharing this with the team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experienced in the Microsoft suite of tools<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> What do we ask for?<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> A team member who loves Talent Acquisition as much as we do (and that’s a lot!)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A brand ambassador with 4+ years of Talent Acquisition experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience recruiting for salaried positions in Construction or Transit sectors<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent oral and written communication skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience with Diversity, Equality, and Inclusion programs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excited about making tomorrow a better place!<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Wants to be part of a great culture and get involved withmany employee engagement activities<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> What we offer<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> A competitive salary and incentives<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Benefits programs, including health and dental coverage and pension plan<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Great tools to do your job!<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A fun and diverse team to work with<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>VINCI Construction Grands Projets emploie plus de 7000 collaborateurs et réalise un chiffre d'affaires de 2,5 md€ (données 2021). Héritier d'entreprises centenaires, qui ont associé leurs noms à des références majeures à l'échelle internationale, VINCI Construction Grands Projets maîtrise l'ensemble des savoir-faire liés à la réalisation d'ouvrages complexes. VINCI Construction Grands Projets conçoit et réalise partout dans le monde de grands ouvrages de génie civil et de bâtiment : infrastructures de transport (ponts et viaducs, travaux souterrains, linéaires de surface et maritimes), bâtiments (tours de bureaux et de logements, parkings, aéroports, ouvrages administratifs et culturels), énergies et oil &amp; gas (réservoirs GNL, centrales thermiques et nucléaires), infrastructures minières (accès, terrassements, travaux souterrains et à ciel ouvert, génie civil), infrastructures hydrauliques (barrages, stations de pompage et de traitement des eaux usées, distribution et évacuation des eaux) et environnement (systèmes d'assainissement et d'amélioration des réseaux d'eau potable, centres d'enfouissement technique). Le haut niveau d'expertise de VINCI Construction Grands Projets et sa forte capacité d'ingénierie et de management de projets vont de pair avec une organisation réactive et une politique de partenariat avec les entreprises locales, lui permettant de déployer des solutions à la fois globales et modulables.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Dodin Québec, filiale de VINCI Construction, est spécialisée dans le management et la réalisation de projets d'infrastructure complexes ainsi que dans la construction de grands ouvrages de génie civil et de bâtiment. <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>VINCI Construction est une filiale de VINCI, acteur mondial des métiers des concessions et de la construction, qui emploie plus de 183 000 collaborateurs dans une centaine de pays. <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Dodin Québec Inc. est à la recherche d'un(e) Surintendant(e) pour notre projet du Renouveau La Fontaine (RLF).<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <h4 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> RLF inc. a confié l ensemble des activités de cette réalisation hors norme à RLF s.e.n.c. composé de Pomerleau, Dodin QC et Eurovia QC. Ce consortium a été désigné par le Ministère des Transports du Québec pour la réfection majeure du tunnel Louis-Hippolyte-La Fontaine, le plus long tunnel immergé au Canada et de ses approches via les autoroutes 20 et 25. Pendant la durée des travaux, le groupement d entreprises sera responsable de l exploitation, de l entretien et de la maintenance des différents sites et axes de circulation.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh4> \n <h4 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Parce que notre vision de la réussite est globale et va au-delà de ses résultats économiques, les membres du consortium s engagent sur la performance environnementale, sociale et sociétale de ses activités.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh4> \n <h4 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Joignez-vous à une équipe novatrice et passionnée par les défis !<\u002Fb><\u002Fh4> \n <p><i> Ce que vous allez faire : <\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <p>Sous la responsabilité du Directeur des travaux Tunnel, le Surintendant Tunnel doit principalement voir à la gestion de l ensemble des activités liés du chantier. <p><b>Company Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> A division of VINCI Construction Grands Projets, <b>JANIN ATLAS<\u002Fb> is an industry leader in the construction of major heavy civil and building projects.<\u002Fp> \n <p> VINCI Construction Grands Projets is itself a subsidiary of VINCI, a world-class leader in construction and concession projects which employs more than 183 000 people in over a hundred countries.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> JANIN ATLAS<\u002Fb> undertakes design-build projects, turn-key projects, as well as more traditional build-only projects, all with a high degree of technical difficulty. We are specialized in the construction of complex projects such as bridges, major highway infrastructure or large-diameter tunnels, all of which require important management and coordination resources.<br> Our projects are characterized by innovative contractual solutions: Partnerships, ECI <i>(Early Contractor Involvement), FEED (Front-End Engineering Design) <\u002Fi>and EPC <i>(Engineering, Procurement and Construction)<\u002Fi>.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We also offer extensive experience in multiple project financing solutions <i>(BOT, DBFOT, PPP, Concessions)<\u002Fi>.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Project Overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> The Confederation Line Extension Project - one of the components of the City of Ottawa Stage 2 O-Train system – includes the design, construction and financing of 27,5kilometres of light rail infrastructure. The scope of work also includes 4 kilometres of cut-and cover tunnels, 20 engineered structures, 16 stations and a light maintenance service facility.<\u002Fp> \n <p> When complete, Stage 2 will bring 77 percent of residents within five kilometres of rail transportation. It will greatly enhance the quality of life in Ottawa, contributing to shorter commutes, cleaner air and a stronger economy. It will also help the city prepare for continued growth, with a population that is expected to reach 1.1 million by 2031.<\u002Fp> \n <p> In April 2019, Kiewit-Eurovia-VINCI (KEV) was selected to design, build and finance the project. Construction is anticipated to be complete for the Confederation Line East extension in 2024 and in 2025 for the Confederation Line West extension.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Position purpose:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As a Superintendent, you will play a significant part in the success of the OLRT's project and set the highest expectations among your crew for saefty, quality, schedule, cost performance and team development. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Principle Accountability and Responsibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i> General Description: <\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Form and lead an effective discipline team, delegating responsibilities and setting goals<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist in the hiring, training and development of craft personnel (laborers, craft workers, foreman etc.)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop and maintain open communications with crews, Field Engineers\u002FCoordinators, Safety, Quality and clients<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist in preparing work plans and scheduling in determining manpower levels, material quantities, and equipment requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Examine\u002Finspect field conditions and troubleshoot problems, correct inaccuracies, and implement cost saving measures<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Monitor and adhere to established budgetary guidelines for job, and ensure that cost control measures are being followed<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Monitor job safety, and provide job safety training and awareness for all personnel<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Monitor standards of all jobs and ensure that all technical specifications are being met<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop three week schedules and participate to today schedules<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Advise senior level superintendents and\u002For project management of potential problems, work interferences, schedule difficulties, etc. Assist in resolving such problems as required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform other job-related duties as requested by your supervisor<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Education and Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>7 and more years of experience in the construction industry within the infrastructure division<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must have at least 5 years' experience of supervisory experience as a Field Engineer<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Understanding of cost management processes, planning and scheduling<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working knowledge of computers and experience using Microsoft Office Suite<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Key Skills and Knowledge: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Highly motivated, with a demonstrated passion for excellence and Canada.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Janin Atlas is characterized by experienced teams sharing values of health and safety, quality, and operational excellence. Janin Atlas is involved in the realization of complex major infrastructure projects related to various fields of activity: transport, hydraulic and mining infrastructures, energy + oil &amp; gas, building, environment.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Janin Atlas is starting a major project in the city of Toronto, ON, Canada and is looking for the best candidates to join the Project team and support the Project delivery.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Project overview : <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>The Ontario Line is a 15.6 km stand-alone rapid transit line that will connect the Ontario Science Centre to Exhibition \u002F Ontario Place.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>The Ontario Line South (OLS) project, is a design-build and finance contract for the 6 km southern portion of the Ontario Line, from Exhibition \u002F Ontario Place to the Don Yard portal (west of Don River)<\u002Fli>\n  <li>The scope of the Project includes the design, construction, and handover of all tunnels (twin tube of 6 km each), 7 stations (turnkey for: 1 station at grade and 6 underground stations) and civil works<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> WE ARE HIRING AN EXPERIENCED ESTIMATOR F\u002FM<\u002Fp>\n <p> What you will do :<\u002Fp>\n <p> Estimate the costs of the portions of the works, in details and in a timely manner; the costs’ estimates shall be detailed and organized to get a rapid understanding and validation from the Project Team management and the Project Sponsor team.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Concretely, your tasks will be :<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Analyze the risks, uncertainties, opportunities of the works<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Obtain, review, analyse and compare the offers and quotes from subcontractors and\u002For suppliers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Establish and analyse the costs ratios of the project<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Make a costs’ estimate synthesis for each new costs’ estimate<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Make a costs’ estimate follow-up table<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure a proper coordination with the project team to establish the most accurate possible costs estimate of the works<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Follow specific KPIs to track the progress and efficiency of the estimating tasks, being part of the changes’ management processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attend coordination meetings with construction and technical teams; make site visits to integrate adequate site practicality<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Who we are looking for :<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> 5 years of professional experience in estimating in the construction industry<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in heavy-civil work<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in design and build projects (and PPP projects)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Proactivity to get and to access the necessary input data<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent presentation and communication skills in English<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Thoroughness and reliability<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong problem-solving abilities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> French and\u002For Spanish language skills is\u002Fare a plus<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Do not hesitate and join us on this new challenging project !<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>VINCI Construction Grands Projets emploie plus de 7000 collaborateurs et réalise un chiffre d'affaires de 2,5 md€ (données 2021). Héritier d'entreprises centenaires, qui ont associé leurs noms à des références majeures à l'échelle internationale, VINCI Construction Grands Projets maîtrise l'ensemble des savoir-faire liés à la réalisation d'ouvrages complexes. VINCI Construction Grands Projets conçoit et réalise partout dans le monde de grands ouvrages de génie civil et de bâtiment : infrastructures de transport (ponts et viaducs, travaux souterrains, linéaires de surface et maritimes), bâtiments (tours de bureaux et de logements, parkings, aéroports, ouvrages administratifs et culturels), énergies et oil &amp; gas (réservoirs GNL, centrales thermiques et nucléaires), infrastructures minières (accès, terrassements, travaux souterrains et à ciel ouvert, génie civil), infrastructures hydrauliques (barrages, stations de pompage et de traitement des eaux usées, distribution et évacuation des eaux) et environnement (systèmes d'assainissement et d'amélioration des réseaux d'eau potable, centres d'enfouissement technique). Le haut niveau d'expertise de VINCI Construction Grands Projets et sa forte capacité d'ingénierie et de management de projets vont de pair avec une organisation réactive et une politique de partenariat avec les entreprises locales, lui permettant de déployer des solutions à la fois globales et modulables.<\u002Fp>\n <li>Être un point de contact du service ressources humaines du partenaire qui l’emploie :<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> o Participer à la rédaction des offres pour les employés Staff de son employeur ;<\u002Fp>\n <p> o Transmettre les fiches de mobilisation signées au département contrôle de gestion ;<\u002Fp>\n <p> Faire l’interface lorsque nécessaire entre l’employé et le partenaire.<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Elle met en place des outils et des procédures pour assurer la qualité des principales activités : évaluation de la performance, sondage de satisfaction des employés formation ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Mesure les actions entreprises à travers la mise en place d’indicateurs.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Il définit ses besoins en personnel, fourniture et matériels ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Il est revue (PR 195a)<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Participer à la production documentaire associé au paiement au Jalon (Avis de conformité, CNESST, CCQ)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Baccalauréat en gestion des ressources humaines ou en relations industrielles avec une expérience dans le métier de minimum 12 ans ou une expérience de 5 ans dans un poste similaire.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Les savoir et savoir faire pour ce poste :<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Connaissance code du travail<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Connaissance de la CNESST<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Loi sur les compétences<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Excel avancées<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Développement organisationnel<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Et un savoir-être :<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Leadership<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Excellentes aptitudes en relations interpersonnelles<\u002Fli>\n sur plusieurs projets simultanés<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Eurovia, filiale de VINCI, est l'un des principaux acteurs mondiaux de la construction d'infrastructures de transport et des aménagements urbains. Eurovia réalise et maintient des infrastructures de transport – routes, autoroutes, voies ferrées, plates-formes aéroportuaires et de tramway – et intervient dans l'aménagement de sites industriels, commerciaux et urbains. L'entreprise maîtrise l'ensemble des savoir-faire connexes : démolition et déconstruction, assainissement, terrassement, voirie et réseaux divers, signalisation, ouvrages d'art et murs antibruit. Grâce à son réseau industriel -production de granulats et de matériaux pour la route et les voies ferroviaires- Eurovia maîtrise toute la chaîne d'approvisionnement. Présente dans 15 pays, l'entreprise emploie 39 500 salariés et a réalisé en 2017 un chiffre d'affaires de 8,1 milliards d'euros. Au Canada, Eurovia est présent au Québec, au Saskatchewan, en Alberta et en Colombie-Britannique. Dans le pays, Eurovia compte environ 2 000 collaborateurs et a réalisé en 2017 plus de 600 millions de dollars de chiffres d'affaires.<\u002Fp>\n infrastructure. M\u002FF<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What is the project?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> A six-kilometre tunnel and associated tunnelling works from Exhibition to Don Yard portal (west of the Don River). The scope of the Project includes the design, construction, and handover of all tunnels (twin tube of 6 km each), 7 stations (turnkey for: 1 station at grade and 6 underground stations) and civil works<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What you will do:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Perform BIM Coordination and BIM Modelling activities <\u002Fp>\n <p>Concretely, your tasks will be to:<\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Receive and aggregate Design partners and Trade subcontractors BIM models<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform Quality Control towards BIM Models<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Run visual and automated clash detection of aggregated BIM models (spatial coordination)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Communicate conflicts in model; both real and potential, producing 3D BIM coordination reports, Issues creation, bcf management.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop and maintain BIM object library and design scripts libraries, as per Project BIM\u002FCAD standards<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop and maintain Project BIM models, as per Project BIM\u002FCAD standards<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop\u002FExport CAD drawings, as per Project BIM\u002FCAD standards<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide BIM support to project Engineering and Construction teams for construction coordination, scheduling, and costing: <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Perform 4D simulations and provide with 4D animation outputs<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform quantity take-offs. environmentally sound working environment and a culture of safe and responsible behaviours and attitudes, ensuring safety.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Who we are looking for: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Structural Engineer<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Location: Toronto, ON<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>JANIN ATLAS<\u002Fb>,<b> <\u002Fb>a subsidiary of <b>VINCI Construction <\u002Fb>Grands Projets, specializes in the design and construction of major civil engineering and building works in Canada.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Janin Atlas is characterized by experienced teams sharing values of health and safety, quality, and operational excellence. It is involved in the realization of complex projects related to various fields of activities: transport, hydraulic and mining infrastructures, energy, and oil &amp; gas, building, environment.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are starting a major project in the city of Toronto, ON, Canada. We are looking for the best candidates to join our team and support the project delivery.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Project overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> — The Ontario Line is a 15.6 km stand-alone rapid transit line that will connect the Ontario Science Centre to Exhibition \u002F Ontario Place.<br> — The OLS project, is one of the three P3 contracts to deliver the Ontario Line, it is a design-build and finance contract for the 6 km southern portion of the Ontario Line, from Exhibition \u002F Ontario Place to the Don Yard portal (west of Don River)<br> — The scope of the Project includes the design, construction, and handover of all tunnels (twin tube of 6 km each), 7 stations (turnkey for 1 station at grade and 6 underground stations) and civil works.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Position's Main Objectives<\u002Fb>: Ensure that the detailed design is faithful to the guide drawings; ensure that the detailed design is developed to be effectively and efficiently implemented by the construction team.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Reporting to: <\u002Fb>Structures Design Manager or Structures CTO Manager.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Principal Accountability &amp; Responsibility<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp> \n <p> General advice and co-ordination:<br> Act as a Technical Reference for the construction team; interface with the architectural team; interface with the design team to update the guide drawings in the event of changes in detailed design.<br> Take part and contribute to the design meetings.<br> Attend the site co-ordination meetings.<br> Co-ordinate the MEP drawings for earthing and cast in items.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Management of Staff and Sub-Contractors:<br> Follow-up and manage the performance, and approve the output from the sub-contractors' detailed designers and in house designers for structural detailed design and structural shop drawings.<br> Provide the focus to the independent checking engineer for the review of the designs.<br> Sign off the invoices of the sub-contractors.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Functional Roles and Duties:<br> Review and approve the detailed design outputs from the structural discipline designers.<br> Manage the impact of the structural changes.<br> Manage the closeout of the comments from the independent checking engineer.<br> Verify that the alignment of the tunnels is consistent with the proposed alignment of the track.<br> Manage the Request for Information from the sub-contracted structural detailed designers.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Main Deliverables:<br> Assist in the development of the KPI for design approval in order to build time for the weekly report.<br> Develop and release the design for the Field Change Requests for approval by the independent checking engineer.<br> Issue the necessary permits for the works as well as construction certificates.<br> Release and update the list of Technical Deliverables and the programme of \"Planned Technical Deliverables\".<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Key Skills and Knowledge<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp> \n <p> Expert level of the software needed for deliver the necessary work.<br> Excellent organizational, planning, execution skills.<br> Fluency in English.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Education: <\u002Fb>Degree in Engineering.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Experience<\u002Fb>: minimum 5 years of professional experience in <p>Site Engineer<\u002Fp>\n <p> Location: Toronto, ON<\u002Fp>\n <p> JANIN ATLAS, a subsidiary of VINCI Construction Grands Projets, specializes in the design and construction of major civil engineering and building works in Canada.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Janin Atlas is characterized by experienced teams sharing values of health and safety, quality, and operational excellence. It is involved in the realization of complex projects related to various fields of activities: transport, hydraulic and mining infrastructures, energy, and oil &amp; gas, building, environment.<\u002Fp>\n <p> We are starting a major project in the city of Toronto, ON, Canada. We are looking for the best candidates to join our team and support the project delivery.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Project overview:<\u002Fp>\n <p> — The Ontario Line is a 15.6 km stand-alone rapid transit line that will connect the Ontario Science Centre to Exhibition \u002F Ontario Place.<br> — The OLS project, is one of the three P3 contracts to deliver the Ontario Line, it is a design-build and finance contract for the 6 km southern portion of the Ontario Line, from Exhibition \u002F Ontario Place to the Don Yard portal (west of Don River)<br> — The scope of the Project includes the design, construction, and handover of all tunnels (twin tube of 6 km each), 7 stations (turnkey for 1 station at grade and 6 underground stations) and civil works<\u002Fp>\n <p> Position's Main Objectives:<\u002Fp>\n <p> The Site Engineer is in charge of the production of a technical or geographical section of the project.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Reporting to:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Station Manager or Civil Manager.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Principal Accountability &amp; Responsibility:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Conduct and coordinate his\u002Fher own works section(s), or is in charge of a sub-contractor supervision.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Review and provide feedback on works methods.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Within the frame of the overall project, prepare detailed programme of the works she\u002Fhe in charge.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Coordinate and liaise with Quality and Safety inspectors on a daily basis.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Participate in and\u002For lead task brieffings at the beginning of each shift.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Regularly review and update manpower requirements.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Organise and provide daily documented required records.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Assure compliance of the works activities with the QHSE and the contract requirements.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Prepare requisition orders and work orders.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Alert on any deviation or issue.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Participate in works meetings.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Enhance coordination between the different sections of the works.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ensure that personnel allocated to the works are properly trained, qualified and informed through formalised procedures of selection, induction and tool box talks.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Establish and request the equipment needed for the Project.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Responsible for the proper use of the work facilities and equipment made available and ensures that the safety devices and all the equipment are maintained in sound working condition.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Establish the monitoring documents for the construction works.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Establish and preserves all the documents needed for his\u002Fher scope of Work.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Key Skills and Knowledge:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Expert level of Autocad software and other Methods' software.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Excellent organizational, planning, execution skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Fluency in English.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Education: Degree in Engineering.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Experience: minimum 5 years of professional experience as site engineer and\u002For in Methods.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>VINCI Construction Grands Projets emploie plus de 7000 collaborateurs et réalise un chiffre d'affaires de 2,5 md€ (données 2021). Héritier d'entreprises centenaires, qui ont associé leurs noms à des références majeures à l'échelle internationale, VINCI Construction Grands Projets maîtrise l'ensemble des savoir-faire liés à la réalisation d'ouvrages complexes. VINCI Construction Grands Projets conçoit et réalise partout dans le monde de grands ouvrages de génie civil et de bâtiment : infrastructures de transport (ponts et viaducs, travaux souterrains, linéaires de surface et maritimes), bâtiments (tours de bureaux et de logements, parkings, aéroports, ouvrages administratifs et culturels), énergies et oil &amp; gas (réservoirs GNL, centrales thermiques et nucléaires), infrastructures minières (accès, terrassements, travaux souterrains et à ciel ouvert, génie civil), infrastructures hydrauliques (barrages, stations de pompage et de traitement des eaux usées, distribution et évacuation des eaux) et environnement (systèmes d'assainissement et d'amélioration des réseaux d'eau potable, centres d'enfouissement technique). Le haut niveau d'expertise de VINCI Construction Grands Projets et sa forte capacité d'ingénierie et de management de projets vont de pair avec une organisation réactive et une politique de partenariat avec les entreprises locales, lui permettant de déployer des solutions à la fois globales et modulables.<\u002Fp>\n VINCI Construction Grands Projets conçoit et réalise partout dans le monde de grands ouvrages de génie civil et de bâtiment : infrastructures de transport (ponts et viaducs, travaux souterrains, linéaires de surface et maritimes), bâtiments (tours de bureaux et de logements, parkings, aéroports, ouvrages administratifs et culturels), énergies et oil &amp; gas (réservoirs GNL, centrales thermiques et nucléaires), infrastructures minières (accès, terrassements, travaux souterrains et à ciel ouvert, génie civil), infrastructures hydrauliques (barrages, stations de pompage et de traitement des eaux usées, distribution et évacuation des eaux) et environnement (systèmes d'assainissement et d'amélioration des réseaux d'eau potable, centres d'enfouissement technique). partenariat avec les entreprises locales, lui permettant de déployer des solutions à la fois globales et modulables.<\u002Fp>\n <p>Renouveau La Fontaine (RLF) est le consortium (Eurovia, Pomerleau, et Dodin) désigné par le Ministère des Transports du Québec pour la réfection majeure du tunnel Louis-Hippolyte-La Fontaine, le plus long tunnel immergé au Canada, et de ses approches via les autoroutes 20 et 25.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Notre vision de la réussite est globale et va au-delà des résultats économiques. Renouveau La Fontaine porte un intérêt particulier à ses activités et s’engage à être performante sur le plan environnemental, social et sociétal.<\u002Fp>\n <p> N’attendez plus pour vous joindre à une équipe novatrice et passionnée par les défis !<\u002Fp>\n <p> Votre mission principale \u002F vos responsabilités<\u002Fp>\n <p> Sous la supervision du Technicien informatique senior dédié au projet de réfection du tunnel Louis-Hippolyte-La Fontaine, le Technicien informatique – Niveau 1 sera appelé à effectuer les tâches suivantes :<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Installer des lecteurs sur 7 photocopieuses<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Reprogrammer toutes les cartes d'accès pour les photocopieurs photoRetirer tous les numéros de cartes d'accès en fonction du nom d'utilisateur<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Entrer le numéro de la carte d'accès et numériser vers le lecteur sur l'imprimante nécessaire selon l'utilisateur<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Installer du câblage dans certaines remorques en raison d'une mauvaise réception.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Configurer des IPad :Créer des identifiants Apple pour tous et créer un alias dans AD pour pointer vers l'adresse e-mail de l'utilisateur RLF.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Installer des applications sur les iPads 3<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prendre le numéro de série et le numéro de Sim et l'ajouter sur Excel.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Configurer des ordinateurs portables avec les comptes RLF, les signatures de tous les partenaires et l'ajout de toutes les imprimantes nécessaires avec les bons pilotes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Configurer des téléphones portables (Sony, Apple, Android, etc…)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Mettre à jour les pilotes Windows et Lenovo et HP en cas de besoin<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Dépannage des problèmes survenant quotidiennement avec le matériel et les logiciels Windows- Lenovo -HP.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Installer des stations d'accueil (Docking stations) pour les équipements vidéo et les écrans de câblage réseau.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintenir l'inventaire du matériel et des logiciels<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Qualification et habiletés requises<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Détenir une attestation d’études pertinentes en informatique<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Posséder un minimum de 2 ans d’expérience pertinente en support informatique<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maitrise de la suite MS Office<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Détenir un permis de conduire valide<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Avoir de la facilité avec le service à la clientèle<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Bilinguisme à l’oral et à l’écrit (français et anglais), un atout<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Eurovia, filiale de VINCI, est l'un des principaux acteurs mondiaux de la construction d'infrastructures de transport et des aménagements urbains. Eurovia réalise et maintient des infrastructures de transport – routes, autoroutes, voies ferrées, plates-formes aéroportuaires et de tramway – et intervient dans l'aménagement de sites industriels, commerciaux et urbains. L'entreprise maîtrise l'ensemble des savoir-faire connexes : démolition et déconstruction, assainissement, terrassement, voirie et réseaux divers, signalisation, ouvrages d'art et murs antibruit. Grâce à son réseau industriel -production de granulats et de matériaux pour la route et les voies ferroviaires- Eurovia maîtrise toute la chaîne d'approvisionnement. Présente dans 15 pays, l'entreprise emploie 39 500 salariés et a réalisé en 2017 un chiffre d'affaires de 8,1 milliards d'euros. Au Canada, Eurovia est présent au Québec, au Saskatchewan, en Alberta et en Colombie-Britannique. Dans le pays, Eurovia compte environ 2 000 collaborateurs et a réalisé en 2017 plus de 600 millions de dollars de chiffres d'affaires.<\u002Fp>\n <p>Procurement Officer<br> Location: Toronto, ON<\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <br> Position's Main Objectives: To support the purchase team in addressing and providing solutions for the project's procurement.\n  <br> \n  <br> Reporting to: Procurement Manager\n  <br> \n  <br> Principal Accountability &amp; Responsibility:\n  <br> \n  <br> 1. Execution:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Develop, implement, manage and co-ordinate the procurement processes and be able to use legally established professional and transparent procurement policies and procedures of the project.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Draw up a plan for the purchase of equipment, services and supplies.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Oversee the activities of the department responsible for purchases and stocks.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Approve the best products and\u002For services taking into consideration costs after having reviewed and analysed all options.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ensure that the products and\u002For services have the required quality and stardards, in light of the allocated budget\u002Fprice.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> 2. Supervision:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>As part of its supervising role, the Procurement Officer is responsible for assigning duties to each staff member and review their work regularly.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Effectively supervise assigned staff ensuring they are adequately versed in the relevant practices, procedures and policies.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> 3. Coordination:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Prepare calls for tender and follow-up procedures and manage any type of contract (services, works, and supplies)<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Provide assistance related with procurement matters to the organisation's members.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Act as a main link between the project and its suppliers.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Search for suppliers and negotiate the best deals for the project.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Develop good relationships with suppliers and have demonstrated excellent negotiations skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> 4. Documentation:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Maintain accurate records of purchases and pricing.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ensure that the department has all important details (such as: suppliers’ qualifications, delivery times, potential development, products, etc.).<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Additional preparation of Ad-hoc reports and tasks upon request.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><br> Key Skills and Knowledge:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Excellent negotiation skills with high level of knowledge regarding the Canadian market.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Trust-worthy, goal oriented, creative, innovative and high ability to work under pressure<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Fluent in English. French an asset.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Education: University Degree in Law, Public or Business Administration or equivalent academic or professional training.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Experience: minimum 5 years of professional experience in legal, administrative and operational aspects of Procurement.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>VINCI Construction Grands Projets emploie plus de 7000 collaborateurs et réalise un chiffre d'affaires de 2,5 md€ (données 2021). Héritier d'entreprises centenaires, qui ont associé leurs noms à des références majeures à l'échelle internationale, VINCI Construction Grands Projets maîtrise l'ensemble des savoir-faire liés à la réalisation d'ouvrages complexes. VINCI Construction Grands Projets conçoit et réalise partout dans le monde de grands ouvrages de génie civil et de bâtiment : infrastructures de transport (ponts et viaducs, travaux souterrains, linéaires de surface et maritimes), bâtiments (tours de bureaux et de logements, parkings, aéroports, ouvrages administratifs et culturels), énergies et oil &amp; gas (réservoirs GNL, centrales thermiques et nucléaires), infrastructures minières (accès, terrassements, travaux souterrains et à ciel ouvert, génie civil), infrastructures hydrauliques (barrages, stations de pompage et de traitement des eaux usées, distribution et évacuation des eaux) et environnement (systèmes d'assainissement et d'amélioration des réseaux d'eau potable, centres d'enfouissement technique). Le haut niveau d'expertise de VINCI Construction Grands Projets et sa forte capacité d'ingénierie et de management de projets vont de pair avec une organisation réactive et une politique de partenariat avec les entreprises locales, lui permettant de déployer des solutions à la fois globales et modulables.<\u002Fp>\n Projets, specializes in the design and construction of major civil engineering and building works in Canada is hiring a<\u002Fp>\n <p> BIM Engineer M\u002FF<\u002Fp>\n <p> What is the project?<\u002Fp>\n <p> A six-kilometre tunnel and associated tunnelling works from Exhibition to Don Yard portal (west of the Don River). The scope of the Project includes the design, construction, and handover of all tunnels (twin tube of 6 km each), 7 stations (turnkey for: 1 station at grade and 6 underground stations) and civil works<\u002Fp>\n <p> What you will do:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Perform BIM Coordination and BIM Modelling activities<\u002Fp>\n <p> Concretely, your tasks will be to:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Receive and aggregate Design partners’ and Trade subcontractors’ BIM models<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Perform Quality Control towards BIM Models<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Run visual and automated clash detection of aggregated BIM models (spatial coordination)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Communicate conflicts in model; both real and potential, producing 3D BIM coordination reports, Issues creation, bcf management.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop and maintain BIM object library and design scripts libraries, as per Project BIM\u002FCAD standards<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop and maintain Project BIM models, as per Project BIM\u002FCAD standards<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop\u002FExport CAD drawings, as per Project BIM\u002FCAD standards<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide BIM support to project Engineering and Construction teams for construction coordination, scheduling, and costing:<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Perform 4D simulations and provide with 4D animation outputs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Perform quantity take-offs. Provide trade\u002Fs quantity schedule outputs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Overview laser scanning of existing spaces where required and incorporate into the Federation Models<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Incorporate field data into BIM model as per project Standards and Project BIM Uses<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide BIM Navigation User trainings<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assist development of Cadets and Graduate Engineers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participate in on-the-job development\u002Ftraining<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support, implement and adhere to H&amp;S policies and procedures<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Promote a safe and environmentally sound working environment and a culture of safe and responsible behaviours and attitudes, ensuring safety.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Who we are looking for:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> 3 years of experience minimum with at least 2 years on projects using BIM<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience with Autodesk Revit (Stations) and Civil 3D (civil) and Autodesk Navisworks is mandatory<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience of software applications such as Synchro, Fuzor, Dynamo are a plus<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> You can see yourself in this job advertisement? Héritier d'entreprises centenaires, qui ont associé leurs noms à des références majeures à l'échelle internationale, VINCI Construction Grands Projets maîtrise l'ensemble des savoir-faire liés à la réalisation d'ouvrages complexes. VINCI Construction Grands Projets conçoit et réalise partout dans le monde de grands ouvrages de génie civil et de bâtiment : infrastructures de transport (ponts et viaducs, travaux souterrains, linéaires de surface et maritimes), bâtiments (tours de bureaux et de logements, parkings, aéroports, ouvrages administratifs et culturels), énergies et oil &amp; gas (réservoirs GNL, centrales thermiques et nucléaires), infrastructures minières (accès, terrassements, travaux souterrains et à ciel ouvert, génie civil), infrastructures hydrauliques (barrages, stations de pompage et de traitement des eaux usées, distribution et évacuation des eaux) et environnement (systèmes d'assainissement et d'amélioration des réseaux d'eau potable, centres d'enfouissement technique). Le haut niveau d'expertise de VINCI Construction Grands Projets et sa forte capacité d'ingénierie et de management de projets vont de pair avec une organisation réactive et une politique de partenariat avec les entreprises locales, lui permettant de déployer des solutions à la fois globales et modulables.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Ontario Line South <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>Are you looking for your next adventure? Let us tell you all about it! <\u002Fp>\n <p>Ontario Transit Group are very proud to be part of Ontario s future.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Our teams are mobilizing their design and construction crews, with major works to commence in 2023. The South Civil contract is anticipated to be completed in 2030.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The project will strengthen Ontario s economy by supporting an estimated 1,500 jobs at the peak of construction<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>What is the project?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> A six-kilometre tunnel and associated tunnelling works from Exhibition to Don Yard portal (west of the Don River)<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Stations<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>One above-ground station to be integrated with the existing GO Transit Exhibition Station<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Two underground stations to be integrated with the existing TTC Osgoode and Queen subway stations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Four new underground stations (King\u002FBathurst, Queen\u002FSpadina, Moss Park, Corktown)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>The benefits to Ontario!<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Faster, more frequent and reliable access to rapid transit with more than 227,500 people will live within a 10-minute walk of an Ontario Line station<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Improve the quality of life for commuters by reducing daily travel time<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reduce crowding on the existing Line 1 (Yonge-University) subway<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Up to 57,000 more jobs accessible by transit (in 45 minutes or less) for Toronto residents<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Economic and community growth along the future transit line and thousands of job opportunities annually during construction<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reduction in traffic congestion, greenhouse gases and fuel consumption by providing an alternative transportation option<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Are you the perfect fit?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> The Stations Design Manager, reporting directly to the Design Manager, will be responsible for ensuring technical quality during the design development of the stations on the Ontario Line South project, up to the issuance of for construction documentation. They will have strong technical relationships with design consultants and will engage directly with the client and their technical advisors during the design process.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>What you will undertake:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Leads technical proposals, writes technical and contractual documentation, conceptualizes and develops technical packets in relation to the stations design.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Supports the Design Manager in the development and implementation of the Design Management Plan for the project.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Leads the stations design development and manages high performance design teams and designers in charge of the Detailed Design.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Responsible for ensuring the stations design complies with health, safety, environmental and quality requirements.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Promotes, explores and materialises value engineering opportunities throughout the design process of the stations of the project and contributes to identify and develop new technical opportunities and optimizations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manages processes related to the project's design to ensure that everything is delivered to schedule, working very closely with estimators, quantity surveyors, site managers and other key members of the project team.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Responsible for the design submissions to the Client and for resolving the comments received from them in relation to stations design.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Responsible to provide the necessary technical support to the construction team to develop the construction means and methods for the stations of the project. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Drives and inspires technical excellence by creating an environment of learning and innovation that attracts and develops the best talent reflective of the diversity of our clients.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provides strong leadership by example, leveraging strong organizational, managerial, technical, process, and people management skills that can motivate a team.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <b>What do we ask for?<\u002Fb>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  Civil <p><b>Senior Methods Engineer<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Location: Toronto, ON<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>JANIN ATLAS<\u002Fb>,<b> <\u002Fb>a subsidiary of <b>VINCI Construction <\u002Fb>Grands Projets, specializes in the design and construction of major civil engineering and building works in Canada.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Janin Atlas is characterized by experienced teams sharing values of health and safety, quality, and operational excellence. It is involved in the realization of complex projects related to various fields of activities: transport, hydraulic and mining infrastructures, energy, and oil &amp; gas, building, environment.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are starting a major project in the city of Toronto, ON, Canada. We are looking for the best candidates to join our team and support the project delivery.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Project overview:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> — The Ontario Line is a 15.6 km stand-alone rapid transit line that will connect the Ontario Science Centre to Exhibition \u002F Ontario Place.<br> — The OLS project, is one of the three P3 contracts to deliver the Ontario Line, it is a design-build and finance contract for the 6 km southern portion of the Ontario Line, from Exhibition \u002F Ontario Place to the Don Yard portal (west of Don River)<br> — The scope of the Project includes the design, construction, and handover of all tunnels (twin tube of 6 km each), 7 stations (turnkey for 1 station at grade and 6 underground stations) and civil works<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Position's Main Objectives<\u002Fb>: Develop all the necessary drawings and documentation to the construction team, ensuring the safely and timely delivery of all aspects defined by the design team.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Reporting to: <\u002Fb>Methods &amp; Temporary Works Manager<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Principal Accountability &amp; Responsibility<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp> \n <p> Establish the efficient and safe methodology to be deployed in constructing both temporary and permanent works, including the calculations, technical notes and specifications to support the chosen methods, as well as the assessment of risks as per the project's Safety in Design procedure in place.<br> Develop site layouts, fence drawings, site installations, logistic strategy, cranes loading schedule, traffic management drawings in safe and healthy conditions.<br> Produce concrete outline drawings for non-structural concrete outside the stations, including the blinding and the masse concrete drawings.<br> Define the drainage systems in coordination with Geotechnical Engineer.<br> Produce the Support of Excavation drawings in coordination with the concerning department team. <br> Determine the correct and efficient sequence of the works including the excavation sequence.<br> Define the formwork and falsework systems and their cycle, which will be used in constructing the permanent works. Liaise with the logistics\u002Fplant department as to identify tools and materials available.<br> Provide the construction team with the principles of the works' method statements. Review it when requested and\u002For suggest improvements.<br> Propose innovative methods of construction including off-site fabrication and pre-casting techniques when feasible.<br> Follow the well implementation of the method document by making regular site visits and by liaising with the Methods &amp; Temporary Works Manager. <br> Prepare \u002F settle on the Field Method Modification Requests.<br> Prepare the information to be included in the experience shared report for the project.<br> Take part in site, design and\u002For interface meetings as required.<br> Ensure that the draftsmen are well trained and use the proper tools and software.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Site:<br> Constantly review progress on site and seek for the means of improving the construction cycle whilst maintaining the safety and quality aspirations of the project.<br> During the preparation period of the construction methods, organise workshop meetings with other departments to optimize the construction methods and incorporate to the methods drawings the safety and quality issues.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Quality:<br> Ensure the planning and methods documents are effectively controlled and distributed.<br> For each construction activity, make sure that the proper methods of works are planned for and grant the safety and quality of the works. Review constructability issues.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Key Skills and Knowledge<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp> \n <p> Expert level of Autocad software and other Methods' software.<br> Excellent organizational, planning, execution skills.<br> Fluency in English.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Education: <\u002Fb>Degree in Engineering.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Experience<\u002Fb>: minimum 5 years of professional experience in Methods.<\u002Fp>\n<\u002Fdiv>","contentKind":"HTML"},"screenerRequirementsModel":null,"showExpiredHeader":false,"tagModels":null,"viewJobDisplay":"DESKTOP_EMBEDDED"},"sectionedJobInfoModel":null},"jobKey":"c6628deda63679be","jobLocation":"Toronto, Vous gérerez l’exécution technique du projet ainsi que les suivis administratifs.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> Gestion de projets <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Surveiller et valider l’exécution des travaux en fonction des plans, devis et autres spécifications ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assurer le respect des échéanciers et la qualité des travaux ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Planifier les ressources matérielles, humaines et financières du projet ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Conseiller et proposer de nouveaux procédés ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participer aux réunions de coordination de chantier.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Identifier et résoudre les problèmes techniques en fonction des standards du Groupe.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Contrôle des coûts :<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Effectuer le contrôle des coûts de chantier et proposer des pistes d’amélioration ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Procéder à l’intégration des coûts de chantier dans le système informatique.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Gestion de main-d’œuvre et des sous-traitants:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Vérifier et valider les méthodes de travail des sous-traitants et la qualité des travaux qu’ils effectuent ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Agir à titre de leader et promoteur de la santé et sécurité sur les chantiers.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Diplômé(e) d’une formation ingénieure ou universitaire en Construction (Bac +5) : Bâtiment ; Travaux Publics ; Génie civil. Vous avez une première expérience en conduite de travaux et vous êtes particulièrement motivé(e) par une expérience à l’international.<\u002Fp>\n <p> On vous reconnaît les qualités suivantes :<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Excellent relationnel<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ouverture d’esprit et curiosité<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Autonomie, patience et une forte capacité d'adaptation.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Vous avez une maîtrise de l’anglais avancée (indispensable pour cette mission).<\u002Fp>\n <p> Une précédente expérience à l’étranger. ? Cela sera apprécié.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> POUR ETRE ELIGIBLE AU VIE VOUS DEVEZ ÊTRE :<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Citoyen(e) européen(e) âgé de 18 à 28 ans à la date d'inscription ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Etudiant(e) diplômé(e), avec un niveau courant en anglais ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ne pas avoir déjà fait de V.I.E. ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ne pas avoir travaillé précédemment dans le pays d'accueil.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Eurovia Québec est présent dans dix régions de la Province avec une priorité Santé-Sécurité au travail. L’entreprise emploie actuellement plus de 2 000 collaborateurs qui œuvrent chaque jour pour le bon fonctionnement de nos 22 postes d’enrobages, nos 119 sites et carrières qui nous permettent de réaliser près de 800 chantiers par année. L’expertise et le savoir-faire de l’équipe Eurovia Québec soutiennent plusieurs types de projets : routes, pistes d’aérodrome, ponts, viaducs, égouts, aqueducs, surfaces industrielles, commerciales et institutionnelles.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> POURQUOI NOUS REJOINDRE ?<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Vous rejoindrez une organisation décentralisée où la prise de décision se fait au plus proche du terrain ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Vous souhaitez vous épanouir grâce à un programme de mobilité attractif et rejoindre notre communauté des Young Talents@VINCI Construction ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Vous acquerrez une excellente expérience de travail riche grâce à un environnement de travail inspirant ;<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Vous développerez des compétences techniques et générales grâce au mentorat.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>VINCI Construction est l'un des principaux acteurs mondiaux de la construction, dans le domaine des infrastructures de transport, des bâtiments, des réseaux et des aménagements urbains. VINCI Construction s'appuie sur un réseau de filiales de proximité, un réseau de spécialités et une expertise spécifique sur les grands projets d'infrastructures. Avec plus de 1300 entreprises, VINCI Construction intervient sur l'ensemble du cycle de vie d'un ouvrage (financement, conception, construction, rénovation, maintenance). Ce réseau de plus de 1300 entreprises, présentes dans plus de 100 pays, emploie près de 115 000 personnes et a réalisé un chiffre d'affaires de 26,2 milliards d'euros en 2021. Pour en savoir plus, rendez-vous sur www.vinci-construction.com et suivez nos actualités sur LinkedIn : www.linkedin.com\u002Fcompany\u002Fvinci-construction<\u002Fp>\n <p>Vous aimez créer l’impossible et rien ne vous arrête ?!<\u002Fp>\n <p> Si, vous-aussi, votre philosophie c’est : « Jamais sans ma gang ».<\u002Fp>\n <p> Rejoignez une équipe qui vous ressemble !<\u002Fp>\n <p> Les défis qui vous attendent :<\u002Fp>\n <p> Sous la supervision du directeur d'agence vous allez conseiller, coacher et former les gestionnaires et les travailleurs de votre région en matière de prévention de la santé et de la sécurité au travail. Vous passerez beaucoup de temps au contact de notre personnel œuvrant sur les sites et en chantier afin d’atteindre vos objectifs. Vous serez attitré à la région de l'Estrie, pour nos activités chantiers, carrières, laboratoire, atelier et usine. Vos missions seront les suivantes :<\u002Fp>\n <p> Implantation de la culture prévention :<\u002Fp>\n <p> Créer et maintenir un intérêt actif à la santé et la sécurité afin d’éliminer les accidents.<br> Inciter les travailleurs à faire preuve de leadership et de responsabilité en SST<br> Sensibiliser les travailleurs aux questions de santé et de sécurité.<br> Supporter les différents services dans la démarche d'amélioration continue en SST;<br> Participer à la mise en place et au suivi des comités corporatif et régional<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Gestion des risques d’accidents :<\u002Fp>\n <p> Analyser les risques et proposer des solutions afin de les éliminer.<br> Assurer de la mise en place et du respect du programme de prévention.<br> Effectuer des inspections sur les sites et chantiers.<br> Elaborer et auditer les process santé-sécurité<br> Assister les employés dans la gestion des écarts<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Formation :<\u002Fp>\n <p> Effectuer l’accueil prévention des nouveaux travailleurs<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Suivi réglementaire :<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Assurer la gestion administrative des dossiers de santé et sécurité;<br> Assurer la mise à jour et la diffusion de la documentation (Exemple : au niveau de la sécurisation des sites, procédures de travail, instructions, etc.)<br> Assurer un suivi des lois et règlements applicables;<br> Assurer un suivi au niveau de la Loi 430 Transport<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Avez-vous les qualifications requises pour relever ce défi ?<\u002Fp>\n <p> Formation &amp; expérience :<\u002Fp>\n <p> Être détenteur d’un diplôme d’étude collégiale en sécurité au travail;<br> Posséder un minimum de 3 années d’expérience pertinente;<br> Détenir la carte de santé et sécurité sur les chantiers de construction (Atout)<br> Maîtriser la code de sécurité des travaux de construction.<\u002Fp>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Faire partie d’Eurovia, c’est :<\u002Fp>\n <p> Rejoindre un leader mondial de la construction,<br> Des perspectives de carrière illimitées locales ou à travers le monde,<br> 17 bureaux régionaux partout à travers la Province,<br> Une assurance santé adaptée à tes besoins et ceux de ta famille,<br> Un programme d’achat d’actions avantageux,<br> Un programme de formation,<br> Un régime de retraite compétitif,<br> Un club social dynamique (Cirque du Soleil, billets de spectacle, Tournoi de golf, Match des Canadiens, Souper de homards, etc.)<br> Des rabais corporatifs (spa, golf, salle de sport, casino, forfaits mobiles, la Ronde...)<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Et si nous bâtissions votre carrière ensemble ?<\u002Fp>\n <p> Un aperçu de vos opportunités avec nous :<\u002Fp>\n <p> Santé et sécurité: Agent de prévention » Coordonnateur prévention<br> Environnement : Conseiller environnement » Directeur environnement et système de management<br> Système de management : Conseiller système de management » Directeur environnement et système de management<br> Ressources humaines: Conseiller ressources humaines » Directeur ressources humaines<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Eurovia, filiale de VINCI, est l'un des principaux acteurs mondiaux de la construction d'infrastructures de transport et des aménagements urbains. Eurovia réalise et maintient des infrastructures de transport – routes, autoroutes, voies ferrées, plates-formes aéroportuaires et de tramway – et intervient dans l'aménagement de sites industriels, commerciaux et urbains. L'entreprise maîtrise l'ensemble des savoir-faire connexes : démolition et déconstruction, assainissement, terrassement, voirie et réseaux divers, signalisation, ouvrages d'art et murs antibruit. Grâce à son réseau industriel -production de granulats et de matériaux pour la route et les voies ferroviaires- Eurovia maîtrise toute la chaîne d'approvisionnement. Présente dans 15 pays, l'entreprise emploie 39 500 salariés et a réalisé en 2017 un chiffre d'affaires de 8,1 milliards d'euros. Au Canada, Eurovia est présent au Québec, au Saskatchewan, en Alberta et en Colombie-Britannique. Dans le pays, Eurovia compte environ 2 000 collaborateurs et a réalisé en 2017 plus de 600 millions de dollars de chiffres d'affaires.<\u002Fp>\n Projets, part of the VINCI Group, construction worldwide leader, specialized in the design and construction of major civil engineering and building works in Canada is hiring an<\u002Fp>\n <p> Electrical Field Engineer<\u002Fp>\n <p> What is the project?<\u002Fp>\n <p> The Confederation Line Extension Project - one of the components of the City of Ottawa Stage 2 O-Train system – includes the design, construction and financing of 27,5kilometres of light rail infrastructure. The scope of work also includes 4 kilometres of cut-and cover tunnels, 20 engineered structures, 16 stations and a light maintenance service facility.<\u002Fp>\n <p> What you will do:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Support and execute the validation program to demonstrate the Technical, RAM, Safety and Security requirements of the project scope<\u002Fp>\n <p> Concretely, your tasks will be to:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Draft documents related to Testing &amp; Commissioning program (Inspection Test Plan, Test Procedures for functional, performance, Interface and integration tests and asset lists)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Manage, carry out, participates in the Testing &amp; Commissioning activities for the scope he\u002Fshe is in charge<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Witness Tests activities and prepare Test Reports<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Capture and collect records to ensure proper traceability.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Assess and validate test report from Vendor \u002F Subcontractor, follow-up and report the progress of the Test activities for the scope he\u002Fshe in charge<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Manage master defect \u002F punch list and ensure all issues recorded during witnessed and executed testing are registered as required by governing process and progressed towards resolution<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Perform verification of prerequisite testing and development of testing schedule for commissioning activities<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> The position requires Technical Competencies, good communication &amp; presentation skills (in English) and able to work in multi-disciplined and culturally diverse background environments.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Who we are looking for:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Bachelor or Master Engineering in Electrical works (Electricity in North America, CSA\u002FESA, for commercial\u002Findustrial buildings)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Basic Knowledge in Systems Assurance i.e. Requirement management \u002F RAM \u002F Safety Security Ability in Technical coordination and interface management<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> What do we have to provide:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> 3 vacation weeks &amp; 3 emergency\u002Fsickness days paid<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Profit sharing and performance retribution systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Group Health Insurance (premium participation including virtual health care system)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Wellness spending account<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Monthly public transportation participation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Career development opportunities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Free coffee &amp; tea<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A cosmopolite work environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attractive and challenging project<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> You can see yourself in this job advertisement? Do not hesitate anymore, apply and meet our HR team !<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>VINCI Construction Grands Projets emploie plus de 7000 collaborateurs et réalise un chiffre d'affaires de 2,5 md€ (données 2021). Héritier d'entreprises centenaires, qui ont associé leurs noms à des références majeures à l'échelle internationale, VINCI Construction Grands Projets maîtrise l'ensemble des savoir-faire liés à la réalisation d'ouvrages complexes. VINCI Construction Grands Projets conçoit et réalise partout dans le monde de grands ouvrages de génie civil et de bâtiment : infrastructures de transport (ponts et viaducs, travaux souterrains, linéaires de surface et maritimes), bâtiments (tours de bureaux et de logements, parkings, aéroports, ouvrages administratifs et culturels), énergies et oil &amp; gas (réservoirs GNL, centrales thermiques et nucléaires), infrastructures minières (accès, terrassements, travaux souterrains et à ciel ouvert, génie civil), infrastructures hydrauliques (barrages, stations de pompage et de traitement des eaux usées, distribution et évacuation des eaux) et environnement (systèmes d'assainissement et d'amélioration des réseaux d'eau potable, centres d'enfouissement technique). Le haut niveau d'expertise de VINCI Construction Grands Projets et sa forte capacité d'ingénierie et de management de projets vont de pair avec une organisation réactive et une politique de partenariat avec les entreprises locales, lui permettant de déployer des solutions à la fois globales et modulables.<\u002Fp>\n
